intro: Tabernaemontana celastroides, commonly known as the African star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking, lantern-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are unisexual and clustered in cyathia. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
